alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 7:39PM CST until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Rock Island, Henry IL and Whiteside Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rock River near Joslin. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water affects low lying agricultural land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CST Thursday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The river is undergoing the first of two crests. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to 11.8 feet. It will then rise above flood stage Sunday evening to 12.2 feet Wednesday morning. It will fall below flood stage again early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Friday morning.
